body: This might be related to #3751 . Executing ```python %load_ext cython ``` ``` python %%cython --verbose -f -c=-O3 -c=-march=native -c=-Rpass=loop-vectorize # cython: boundscheck = False, wraparound = False def mydot(double[::1] a, double[::1] b): cdef double s = 0.0 cdef int i, N = a.size for i in range(N): s += a[i]*b[i] return s ``` inside a iPython shell prints a few compiler messages regarding successful loop-vectorization due to the `-Rpass=loop-vectorize` flag: When doing the same inside a jupyter notebook, the compiler messages are omitted. This is really annoying in case you'd like to know if the C compiler was able to SIMD-vectorize the C-code generated by Cython. The compiler messages are visible in the logs of the jupyter notebook but not inside the notebook itself: PS: I'm using clang, gcc's equivalent flag is `-fopt-info-vec-optimized` and `/Qvec-report:2` for MVSC. The behavior is the same on linux or windows. ``` Cython : 0.29.21 jupyter core : 4.6.3 jupyter-notebook : 6.1.1 qtconsole : not installed ipython : 7.17.0 ipykernel : 5.3.4 jupyter client : 6.1.6 jupyter lab : 2.2.2 nbconvert : 5.6.1 ipywidgets : not installed nbformat : 5.0.7 traitlets : 4.3.3 ```
title: [BUG] Jupyter Notebook omits compiler messages when using cythonmagic
